skill.name: gtars
skill.description: High-performance toolkit for genomic interval analysis in Rust with Python bindings. Use when working with genomic regions, BED files, coverage tracks, overlap detection, tokenization for ML models, or fragment analysis in computational genomics and machine learning applications.
skill.summary: High-performance toolkit for genomic interval analysis in Rust with Python bindings. Use when workin...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 209 static findings are false positives. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown documentation syntax as security risks. No malicious code present. This is a legitimate genomic analysis toolkit.

content.user_title: Analyze genomic intervals and coverage tracks
content.value_statement: Process and analyze genomic interval data for bioinformatics research. Gtars provides high-performance tools for overlap detection, coverage analysis, and ML tokenization of genomic sequences.
actual_capabilities: Detect overlaps between genomic regions using IGD indexing
Generate coverage tracks from sequencing data in WIG and BigWig formats
Tokenize genomic regions for machine learning applications
Process reference genome sequences following GA4GH refget protocol
Split and analyze fragment files for single-cell genomics
limitations: Requires genomic interval files in standard formats (BED, WIG, BigWig, FASTA)
CLI installation requires Rust toolchain for full feature set
Memory-mapped processing may require sufficient RAM for very large files

use_cases.title: Peak overlap analysis
use_cases.description: Identify overlapping regulatory elements and annotate variants by comparing ChIP-seq peaks.

use_cases.title: Coverage visualization
use_cases.description: Generate coverage tracks from ATAC-seq or ChIP-seq data for genome browser visualization.

use_cases.title: Genomic ML preprocessing
use_cases.description: Convert genomic regions into discrete tokens for training transformer models on DNA sequences.

prompt_templates.title: Basic overlap query
prompt_templates.prompt: Use gtars to build an IGD index from my peaks.bed file and query overlaps with promoters.bed.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a BigWig coverage track from my ATAC-seq fragments using gtars uniwig with 10bp resolution.

prompt_templates.title: ML tokenization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a TreeTokenizer from my training_regions.bed and tokenize the genomic coordinates for ML model input.

prompt_templates.title: Fragment processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Split my fragments.tsv by cell barcodes using gtars fragsplit and output to cluster-specific directories.

output_examples.input: Find overlaps between my ChIP-seq peaks and gene promoters
output: Peak distribution: 45% in promoter regions, 30% in enhancers, 25% intergenic

output_examples.input: Generate coverage track from ATAC-seq data

best_practices: Use memory-mapped mode (mmap=True) when processing large genomic files for better performance.
Build IGD indexes once and reuse them for multiple overlap queries.
Specify thread count explicitly for predictable resource usage in batch processing.
anti_patterns: Do not process GB-scale files without enabling memory-mapped mode.
Avoid running multiple gtars commands sequentially when parallel processing is available.
Do not skip format validation when integrating with external pipelines.

faq.question: What file formats does gtars support?
faq.answer: Gtars supports BED for intervals, WIG/BigWig for coverage tracks, FASTA for reference genomes, and TSV for fragment files.

faq.question: Do I need Rust installed to use gtars?
faq.answer: Python bindings work without Rust. The CLI requires Rust/Cargo only if installing from source.

faq.question: How does gtars compare to bedtools?
faq.answer: Gtars offers similar interval operations with Rust performance, plus specialized ML tokenization and BigWig support.

faq.question: Can gtars handle chromosome-scale files?
faq.answer: Yes, memory-mapped mode enables processing of chromosome-scale files with minimal RAM usage.

faq.question: What is IGD indexing?
faq.answer: Integrated Genome Database is a data structure for fast overlap queries on large genomic interval collections.

faq.question: Is gtars compatible with geniml?
faq.answer: Yes, gtars is the foundation for geniml and provides core preprocessing operations for genomic ML workflows.
